sentences.sContent: The book is expected to dominate the best-seller lists.
sentences.sCn: 这本书预期将占据畅销书榜首的位置。

sentences.sContent: ...countries where life is dominated by war.
Selling could continue to dominate as investors play it safe.
sentences.sCn: 因为投资者们谨慎行事,售出可能会继续占主流。

synos.tran: 控制；支配；占优势；在…中占主要地位

remMethod.val: domin( = dom， 支配) + ate(做) → 支配， 控制

words.tran: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
占主导地位的；强势的；占统治地位的；[数] 受控的
控制，支配；处于支配地位（dominate的过去式）

trans.tranCn: 处于支配地位， 拥有优势
trans.tranOther: To dominate a situation means to be the most powerful or important person or thing in it

trans.tranCn: 在…中占首要地位；主宰，支配，统治，控制；占优势；耸立于，俯视
trans.tranOther: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things
